sailpoint.integration
Class SailPointHttpClient

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.integration.SailPointHttpClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpClient
public class SailPointHttpClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpClient

A custom implementation of HttpClient. By default we use the ApacheHttpClient.

Method Detail

setup

public void setup(boolean useSSL,
                  int port,
                  java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String timeoutInSeconds,
                  java.util.Map options)
Setup the client. This throws an UnsupportedOperationException useSSL is true. Also, port is ignored - this is pulled off of the URL for each request.

Specified by:
setup in interface HttpClient
Parameters:
useSSL - Whether to use SSL or not.
port - The port to use for the requests.
username - The username for basic HTTP auth (optional).
password - The password for basic HTTP auth (optional).
timeoutInSeconds - The request timeout in seconds (optional).
options - A map of options used to configure this client (optional).

setSimulateIE

public void setSimulateIE(boolean b)

reset

public void reset()
Called by tests when they want to simulate the effect of killing the browser and starting a new one. Close any open connections, clear cookies, clear basic auth state.

setFollowRedirects

public void setFollowRedirects(boolean b)
Control whether we automatically follow redirects.

getDomain

public java.lang.String getDomain(java.lang.String host)
Given a fully qualified hostname, extract the domain name. Not sure how smart we need to be here, assume we'll get the last two items in the list, e.g. foo.bar.example.com results in .example.com
